prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Educational Media Association. Records, 1952-2001. Accession [cite specific accession number and date used]. Organization Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p:
Gift of Virginia Educational Media Association, in various accessions:
Accession 35673, received 14 January 1998
Accession 36167, received 28 October 1998
Accession 37093, received 19 November 1999
Accession 38037, received 11 April 2001
Accession 40363, received 10 January 2003
Accession 43479, received 10 October 2007
Accession 44424, received 6 August 2009
Accession 50225, received 18 November 2011

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The Virginia Educational Media Association (VEMA) was formed in 1975 when the Virginia Association for Educational Communications and Technology (VAECT) and the Virginia Education Association--School Librarian Department (VEA-SLD) merged. VEMA's mission is to be the recognized voice for excellence in Virginia's school libraries. Its aim is to promote literacy, information access and evaluation, love of literature, effective use of technology, collaboration in the teaching/learning process, intellectual freedom, professional growth, instructional leadership, and lifelong learning.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records, 1952-2002, of the Virginia Educational Media Association (VEMA) consisting of its organizational files, board meeting minutes, president's papers, financial records, annual conference files, education files, subject files, directories, published materials, and miscellaneous files. Organizational files include joint study by VAECT and VEA-SLD for merger, constitution, motion books, and policies and procedures handbooks. Board meeting files consist of executive board minutes, board minutes, annual conference minutes, reports, budgets, correspondence, position papers, scholarships and awards, election results, agenda, membership lists, goals, and other related papers. President's papers files include AASL affiliation application, awards and scholarships, budgets, reports, correspondence, committees, VEMA and Virginia Library Association joint conference papers, and minutes. Financial records consist of cash receipts and payments records, check stubs and cancelled checks, bank statements and records, accounting records, and treasurer's financial reports. Annual conference files include the minutes of the annual meetings, programs, and award announcements. Education files consist of annual reports and bank statements for scholarships and awards, Dickinson Scholarship applications, Student Media Festival, School Library Media Day and Month, leadership conference files, and regional conference files. Subject files include board lists, position papers, certification studies, studies, MEMO records, minutes, photographs and newspaper clippings, membership forms and brochures, Governor's Conference on Library and Information Services, Southern Regional Media Leadership Council, and AECT membership files. Directories list both the VEMA board and general membership.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:
